meanings.def: a small hard fruit with a very hard shell that grows on some trees
examples: to crack a nut (= open it)
She has a severe nut allergy.

meanings.def: a small piece of metal with a hole through the centre that is screwed onto a bolt to hold pieces of wood, parts of machines, etc. together
examples: a jar full of nuts and bolts
He's a complete nut, if you ask me.

meanings.def: a person who is extremely interested in a particular subject, activity, etc.

examples: She’ll do her nut when she finds out!

meanings.def: a person who is difficult to deal with or to influence
a difficult problem or situation to deal with
the basic practical details of a subject or an activity
examples: The documentary focuses on the real nuts and bolts of the film-making process.

meanings.def: to use more force than is necessary

examples: She’ll do her nut when she finds out!

idioms.def: a person who is difficult to deal with or to influence
a difficult problem or situation to deal with
the basic practical details of a subject or an activity
examples: The documentary focuses on the real nuts and bolts of the film-making process.

idioms.idiom: use a sledgehammer to crack a nut
idioms.def: to use more force than is necessary

meanings.def: to deliberately hit somebody hard with your head
examples: He grabbed my tie and I thought he was going to nut me in the face.
